body: @nmittler @ejona86 can we get around this without exposing it again ?

I just chatted with @carl-mastrangelo offline and this is blocking them from migrating to 4.1.9.Final.  Easiest thing would be to just expose it.

@Scottmitch any objections?
FYI: we (gRPC Team) don't mind too much working around breaking method signatures and moving code.  We accept that the HTTP/2 API is unstable.

issue.title: Expose HTTP/2 HpackDecoder

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

gRPC (and potentially other libraries) has an optimized header processor that requires direct access to the HpackDecoder.

Modifications:

Make the HpackDecoder and its constructors public.

Result:

Fixes #6579

issue.title: Avoid exposing HPACK classes

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
HPACK is an internal detail of HTTP/2 and if possible it would be nice to avoid exposing this in the public interface of the codec-http2. Recently PR https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/6589 exposed `HpackDecoder` for extensibility reasons. In this particular case the extensibility point seemed to be focused on creating a different type of `Http2Headers` object than `DefaultHttp2Headers`. I would like to propose an alternative approach to exposing `HpackDecoder` and instead make `DefaultHttp2HeadersDecoder`'s creation of the `Http2Header` object overridable. In this particular case [GrpcHttp2HeadersDecoder](https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/blob/master/netty/src/main/java/io/grpc/netty/GrpcHttp2HeadersDecoder.java) is duplicating logic which also exists in `DefaultHttp2HeadersDecoder` and IMO would be nice to remove this duplication and consolidate the logic in `DefaultHttp2HeadersDecoder`.

Related:
https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/6579
https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/6589

issue.title: Vert.x 3.4.0 doesn't start with Netty 4.1.9.Final

repository.name: vert.x
repository.description: Vert.x is a tool-kit for building reactive applications on the JVM

issue.body:
```
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: io.netty.resolver.HostsFileParser.parseSilently()Ljava/util/Map;
	at io.vertx.core.impl.AddressResolver.<init>(AddressResolver.java:156)
	at io.vertx.core.impl.VertxImpl.<init>(VertxImpl.java:157)
	at io.vertx.core.impl.VertxImpl.<init>(VertxImpl.java:123)
	at io.vertx.core.impl.VertxImpl.<init>(VertxImpl.java:119)
	at io.vertx.core.impl.VertxFactoryImpl.vertx(VertxFactoryImpl.java:34)
	at io.vertx.core.Vertx.vertx(Vertx.java:80)
```

body: Thanks everyone for working on this. I'm really existed to use this when released.

@guillaumecle - Just to clarify your end goal is just to use gRPC after it has consumed a new version of Netty, not necessarily directly using the HPACK classes, correct?

I would like to avoid exposing HPACK if possible (see https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/6591)
Correct, especially use cloud-bigtable-client after it has consumed new versions of gRPC and Netty.

issue.title: GrpcHttp2HeadersDecoder uses netty internal classes and fails with netty 4.1.10

repository.name: grpc-java
repository.description: The Java gRPC implementation. HTTP/2 based RPC

issue.body:
### Expected behavior
Due to an endianess bug in netty I have to use the fixed version netty 4.1.10
Unfortunatly GrpcHttp2HeadersDecoder references:
import io.netty.handler.codec.http2.internal.hpack.Decoder;
which is gone with netty 4.1.10

### Actual behavior
Execution fails with:
Exception in thread "grpc-default-executor-1" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: io/netty/handler/codec/http2/internal/hpack/Decoder
	at io.grpc.netty.GrpcHttp2HeadersDecoder.<init>(GrpcHttp2HeadersDecoder.java:85)
	at io.grpc.netty.GrpcHttp2HeadersDecoder$GrpcHttp2ClientHeadersDecoder.<init>(GrpcHttp2HeadersDecoder.java:147)
	at io.grpc.netty.NettyClientHandler.newHandler(NettyClientHandler.java:120)
	at io.grpc.netty.NettyClientTransport.newHandler(NettyClientTransport.java:303)
	at io.grpc.netty.NettyClientTransport.start(NettyClientTransport.java:173)
	at io.grpc.internal.ForwardingConnectionClientTransport.start(ForwardingConnectionClientTransport.java:44)
	at io.grpc.internal.TransportSet.startNewTransport(TransportSet.java:233)
	at io.grpc.internal.TransportSet.obtainActiveTransport(TransportSet.java:203)
	at io.grpc.internal.ManagedChannelImpl$3.getTransport(ManagedChannelImpl.java:739)
	at io.grpc.internal.ManagedChannelImpl$3.getTransport(ManagedChannelImpl.java:677)
	at io.grpc.PickFirstBalancerFactory$PickFirstBalancer$1.get(PickFirstBalancerFactory.java:129)
	at io.grpc.internal.DelayedClientTransport$2.run(DelayedClientTransport.java:271)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

### Steps to reproduce
Use netty-all-4.1.10.Final-SNAPSHOT.jar

### Minimal yet complete reproducer code (or URL to code)

### Netty version
4.1.10

### JVM version (e.g. `java -version`)
1.8

### OS version (e.g. `uname -a`)
Windows 10

body: We are really eager to consume this fix, any idea of when Netty 4.1.10.Final will be released?
